What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_List: I learned the basics of statistical mechanics.
Insights about stat mech and quantum mechanics.
This course gave a good overview and introduction to statistical mechanics. I have more confidence in my ability to learn advanced tpics after taking the course.
A comprehension  and ability to generalize statistical mechanics topics. Ising Models, Partition Functions, etc...
The assignments were helpful for applying the concepts learned in the course (specifically the computational assignments). There could be a more rigid syllabus/more organization.
The times when the class were led by Urial were repetitive and not lectures that were efficient and fruitful.
The content is interesting, thats a major strength. Our exams, however, seemed to encourage us to simply memorize derivations instead of understand the implications of those derivations.
It is one of the best courses I have taken

Strengths: Material was very interesting, and Professor Batista presented the material in a way to keep us interested. Lecture notes were good, assignments were not too time consuming but effective in helping to learn.

Weakness: At times lectures could be disorganized.

I thought that the course content was interesting and relevant. I felt that the assignments were useful, especially the computational ones. The exams were sometimes too difficult/long to complete in the allotted time. In particular, the second exam was longer than I would be able to complete in 75 minutes, even if I knew all of the content perfectly.

The information conveyed is very important for my work. The course could improve by having assignments spread out throughout the course. The middle and beginning had very few assignments to test our understanding of the material.
Yes, but you may have to take it several times to really understand and retain the information.

Probably not. The professor did not attend all the lectures and his post-doc who came to lecture for Prof Batista did not explain the concepts well. This was particularly problematic in the beginning of the semester. He also had his students create assignments. I think the course contains important material, though.
I would recommend this course to any student interested in statistical mechanics. If the student was coming from another department, I would strongly recommend that they take quantum mechanics first.
Yes because of the important information covered though it is probably most useful for theoreticians.
